title: 105_hr4046
content: Restrictions on transfers or discharges of nursing facility residents in case of voluntary withdrawal from Medicaid program. Restrictions on transfers or discharges of nursing facility residents in case of voluntary withdrawal from Medicaid program. Amendment to Section 1919(c)(2) of the Social Security Act regarding continuing rights for nursing facilities voluntarily withdrawing from participation in a State plan. Residents cannot be transferred or discharged based solely on the facility's withdrawal. Residents in a nursing facility cannot be transferred or discharged solely due to the facility's withdrawal from the Medicaid program. The facility must continue to follow the provisions of the section until residents are discharged, provide notice to new residents, and obtain acknowledgment of receipt of information. The facility must provide information to new residents, obtain written acknowledgment, and not terminate agreements without advance notice to the State or Secretary. The facility can transfer or discharge a resident if they are unable to pay, even if they become eligible for medical assistance. Payments and oversight for these residents are continued despite other provisions in the title. Residents described in clause (i)(I) can still receive payments and oversight under the State plan for nursing facility services even after a facility voluntarily withdraws from participation. Compliance with requirements and enforcement authority will also be maintained. The provisions outlined in the current text chunk apply to significant voluntary reductions in the extent of participation under a State plan for residents entitled to medical assistance for nursing facility services. The text chunk discusses the effective date of reduction and entitlement to medical assistance for nursing facility services. It also mentions that the amendment applies to voluntary withdrawals occurring after the enactment date. Additionally, a report on implementation is required within 5 years. The amendment applies to voluntary withdrawals from Medicaid participation after the enactment date. A report on the impact of the changes in reimbursement rates on nursing facilities and residents is required within 5 years.
